S. Korean chief executive assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean chief executive assailed 
   Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The "Grand National Party" of South Korea, an opposition party, held an "executive committee meeting" on Wednesday passed a "proposal on forming a special fact-finding committee onï¿½@"presidential election fund" to investigate the chief executive's political fund, a Seoul-based radio reported.   The party ridiculed the remark made by the chief executive at the "dialogue with the people" and press conference, etc held in connection with the lapse of one year of his office that he ceased to win over "parliamentary men" from opposition, and reminded him that actions speak louder than words.

articles.title: Significant February in Korea
Orientation of "Minjurochong's" struggle laid down
articles.content:
Orientation of "Minjurochong's" struggle laid down
    Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions was reported on February 25 to have advanced the confederation's orientation of struggle for stable employment and vital rights.   He pointed out the movement will focus on attaining a number of goals including stop to lay-off under "restructuring"  program, 7.7 % increase of wages and measure for social stability for the unemployed.   He warned the authorities that the confederation would launch a powerful struggle, including a general strike, unless the demands were met.
